about

Hi, I‚Äôm Sage and this is my blog.

I‚Äôm a transfem twenty-something living abroad in Japan. The past couple of years have been a whirlwind: I was diagnosed Autistic at the start of 2024, and began my transition at the start of 2025. As one might expect, those two events have completely altered how I view myself, my life; the world, and my place in it. catloaf & coffee is my place to write as I process and learn more about myself and neurodivergence.

What catloaf & coffee is:

  • A record of processing an Autism diagnosis received in adulthood and transitioning in 2025.
  • Writing intended to reflect neurodivergent thought processes.
  • An inherently deep personal exploration of myself. Naturally, sometimes topics get pretty heavy‚Äîyou‚Äôve been warned. I‚Äôll put content warnings before the really heavy stuff, though.
  • One story of one Autistic and trans person. There are many (wildly varying) stories of such experiences‚Äîthis is mine.

What catloaf & coffee isn‚Äôt:

  • A super-accurate resource on Autism or being transgender. I‚Äôve probably gotten some things wrong already, and I‚Äôll surely get some things wrong in the future. Our knowledge of these topics is rapidly evolving, anyhow. I‚Äôm doing my best, okay?
  • An up-to-date record of my thoughts on various topics. I fully expect that I will come to disagree with things I‚Äôve written, and that‚Äôs okay. Each post is only representative of my thoughts and feelings from when I wrote them.
  • Concise. I intentionally leave in tangents and use an irresponsible amount of em-dashes on catloaf & coffee to reflect how my brain actually works/thinks/processes.
  • Written for anyone but myself. The writing I do here is to help myself process. If someone decides to read along, that‚Äôs great! But, the goal is not to build an audience. I don‚Äôt feel satisfied if I leave all my writing stagnating on a hard drive somewhere, so I self-publish here.

Why should you subscribe?

Good question. I dunno! You probably shouldn‚Äôt. I write just for myself, but you‚Äôre welcome to tag along, if you‚Äôd like. If you choose to subscribe, you‚Äôll receive my posts directly in your inbox (or your Substack app, if you use that) whenever I publish.
